system_javascript_files: Under 'Page Labels' the labels for system special files as default point to javascript files held in the skis sub-project. This is useful if the project and these files are to be served from the same web server. However the buttons below set these labels to point to a CDN server, saving your web server the effort of serving them. You can choose the option below, or set your own CDN servers under 'Page Labels', or revert back to the skis project.
uploaddefaults: If you already have a defaults file and wish to upload it to use with this project, choose the upload function below.
validators.about_error_message: Set the error message to be displayed if the data input fails this validation test.
validators.about_error_ref: If a reference string is given here, rather than an Error Message, then the TextBlock with this reference will be shown as the error message.
validators.add_allowed_value: Values which are automatically validated can be added here.
validators.basic.AllowedValuesOnly: Automatic fail - only passes the allowed values list.
validators.basic.AllowedValuesOrEmpty: Checks the value is in the allowed values list or is empty.
validators.basic.AlphaNumDotUnder: Checks the value is alphanumric, dot or underscore only.
validators.basic.AlphaNumUnder: Checks the value is alphanumric or underscore only.
validators.basic.IntMinMax: Check integer, limit value to between min and max value, fail if input is not an integer string but if it is, and is beyond the range, then does not cause a fail, just limits the integer size.
validators.basic.IntMinMax.maxval: This should be an integer, being the maximum value the input can take.
validators.basic.IntMinMax.minval: This should be an integer, being the minimum value the input can take.
validators.basic.MaxLength: Checks the length of the submitted value is equal or less than the maximum value given.
validators.basic.MaxLength.maxlength: The submitted string must have a length equal or less than the integer value given here.
validators.basic.MinLength: Checks the length of the submitted value is equal or greater than the minimum value given.
validators.basic.MinLength.minlength: The submitted string must have a length equal or greater than the integer value given here.
validators.basic.NoOperation: Always passes, does not raise any error.
validators.basic.NotEmpty: Checks the submitted value is not empty.
validators.basic.Search: Regular expression; passes if pattern search found.
validators.basic.Search.pattern: This is the regular expression, it should be valid for both javascript (on the client side) and Python (on the server side). If a search of this pattern is found, the test is passed.
validators.description: This field can accept one or more validators, these are simple data checks that are tested on the value submitted from the form.
validators.description2:
If one or more Validators are added to this field, the form should call a Responder that runs the validation tests on submitted data.

Typically the validated data will then be stored by the Responder in the call_data dictionary and passed to your submit_data function.
validators.description3: Set a widget used to display the error message should one occur. The section alias can be empty if the widget is not in a section. If both fields are empty, the page default error widget will be used.
validators.description4: A validator can have a list of allowed values, any of these submitted in the field will immediately be passed, anything other than these values must go through the actual validation test.  Do not use 'secret' or back door values here - this list is embedded in the javascript of the page, and can be viewed by a client simply by inspecting the page source code. The purpose of this list is to allow specific exemptions to the test which may be useful in rare circumstances.
validators.description5: This validator takes the following arguments, choose edit to set the argument value.
validators.modules: Validators are defined in the following modules, choose a module:
validators.paths.IdentExists.can_be_empt: If True, an empty value input will be accepted.
validators.paths.IdentExists.is_folder: If True, the check passes if the given ident is that of a Folder.
validators.paths.IdentExists.is_page: If True, the check passes if the given ident is that of a page (a page being a template, responder, filepage etc.,).
validators.paths.NameNotInFolder: Check a name does not already exist in a given folder.
validators.paths.NameNotInFolder.folder_: Set the ident of the folder you wish to check.
validators.paths.PathLeadingTrailingSlas: Ensures leading or trailing slashes are in the given path.
validators.paths.module: Validators for site folder and page checks.
widgets.arg_dict_desc:
This field can have its name changed (alphanumeric and underscore only) if desired.  The value can be set at run time via a PageData object, with a key of the tuple ("%s") and the value being the dictionary to insert here.

Note: If the widget is contained in a section, a SectionData(sectionalias) object should be used instead, with sectionalias being the section alias within the page.
widgets.arg_list_desc:
This field can have its name changed (alphanumeric and underscore only) if desired.  The value can be set at run time via a PageData object with a key of the tuple ("%s") and the value being the list to be set into this field.

If the widget is contained in a section, a SectionData(sectionalias) object should be used instead, with sectionalias being the section alias within the page.
widgets.arg_table_desc:
This field can have its name changed (alphanumeric and underscore only) if desired.  The value can be set at run time via a PageData object with a key of the tuple ("%s") and the value being a list of lists described above.

Note: If the widget is contained in a section, a SectionData(sectionalias) object should be used instead, with sectionalias being the section alias within the page.
widgets.args_desc:
This field can have its name changed (alphanumeric and underscore only) if desired.
The value can be set here, and can also be changed at run time by setting PageData object with a key of the tuple ("%s") and the value being the new value to insert in this field.
Note: If the widget is contained in a section, a SectionData(sectionalias) object should be used instead, with sectionalias being the section alias within the page.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox1:
A checkbox in a div - but without a form or submit button, typically included within a form.
On error, a paragraph above the checkbox will display the error message.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox1.checkbox: The value returned if the checkbox is ticked.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox1.checkbox.full: Set the value of this field to the string which will be returned if the checkbox is ticked. Validators can be added to this field.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox1.checkbox_clas: The CSS class of the checkbox element.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox1.checkbox_styl: The CSS style of the checkbox element.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox1.checked: True if checkbox ticked, False otherwise.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox1.checked.full: Set this field to True if the checkbox is to be shown ticked, False if unticked.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox1.div_class: The CSS class applied to the div after the error paragraph.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox1.div_class.ful: The CSS class applied to the div which contains the label and checkbox, and is after the hidden error paragraph.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox1.div_style: The CSS style applied to the div after the error paragraph.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox1.error_class: The CSS class applied to the normally hidden error paragraph.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox1.error_class.f: The CSS class applied to the normally hidden error paragraph.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox1.left_class: The css class of the label to the left of the checkbox.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox1.left_class.fu: The css class of the label tag to the left of the checkbox. If the field is empty, no class attribute is set.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox1.left_label: The text displayed to the left of the checkbox.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox1.left_label.fu: The text displayed to the left of the checkbox within a 'label' tag. If no text is given no label tag is created. The label tag is given a 'for' attribute with the id of the checkbox input tag.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox1.left_style: The css style of the label to the left of the checkbox.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox1.right_class: The css class of the label to the right of the checkbox.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox1.right_class.f: The css class of the label tag to the right of the checkbox. If the field is empty, no class attribute is set.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox1.right_label: The text displayed to the right of the checkbox.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox1.right_label.f: The text displayed to the right of the checkbox within a 'label' tag. If no text is given no label tag is created. The label tag is given a 'for' attribute with the id of the checkbox input tag.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox1.right_style: The css style of the label to the right of the checkbox.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox2: A checkbox in a span - but without a form or submit button, typically included within a form. Does not display errors.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox2.checkbox: The value returned if the checkbox is ticked.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox2.checkbox.full: Set the value of this field to the string which will be returned if the checkbox is ticked. Validators can be added to this field.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox2.checkbox_clas: The CSS class of the checkbox element.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox2.checkbox_styl: The CSS style of the checkbox element.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox2.checked: True if checkbox ticked, False otherwise.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox2.checked.full: Set this field to True if the checkbox is to be shown ticked, False if unticked.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox2.left_class: The css class of the label to the left of the checkbox.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox2.left_class.fu: The css class of the label tag to the left of the checkbox. If the field is empty, no class attribute is set.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox2.left_label: The text displayed to the left of the checkbox.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox2.left_label.fu: The text displayed to the left of the checkbox within a 'label' tag. If no text is given no label tag is created. The label tag is given a 'for' attribute with the id of the checkbox input tag.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox2.left_style: The css style of the label to the left of the checkbox.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox2.right_class: The css class of the label to the right of the checkbox.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox2.right_class.f: The css class of the label tag to the right of the checkbox. If the field is empty, no class attribute is set.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox2.right_label: The text displayed to the right of the checkbox.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox2.right_label.f: The text displayed to the right of the checkbox within a 'label' tag. If no text is given no label tag is created. The label tag is given a 'for' attribute with the id of the checkbox input tag.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBox2.right_style: The css style of the label to the right of the checkbox.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBoxTable1: A three column table of two text columns and a checkbox column. Without a form or submit button, typically included within a form.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBoxTable1.checkbox: A dictionary of keynames:values for the checkboxes of the third column.
widgets.checkbox.CheckBoxTable1.checked: A list of keynames which will be checked. This field name is used as part of the widgfield returned.
A list of keynames which will be checked. This field name is used as part of the widgfield returned. The returned data will be a dictionary of keynames:values for those keys which have been ticked.

widgets.checkbox.CheckInputs:
A div holding a checkbox with a container to hold further input fields. Without a form or submit button, typically included within a form.
The checkbox controls contained text input fields (not other types of input) which must initially be set as enabled/disabled to match the checkbox state.
The input fields are only enabled when the checkbox is checked, requires javascript enabled on the client browser.

This field sets the 'action' attribute of the form tag. Either a responder page ident, or page label (if the target responder page has been given a label) should be input here, and at run time this will be converted to the correct URL.  Normally you would set the action to call a responder page - or the first in a series of responders, that check the correct fields have been submitted, validates them, stores the results in the call_data dictionary, then submits the data to your code.

widgets.headers.DropDownButton1: A div, button and links, typically used for a drop down list of links.
widgets.headers.DropDownButton1.button_c: The CSS class applied to the button.
widgets.headers.DropDownButton1.button_s: The style applied to the button.
widgets.headers.DropDownButton1.button_t: The text shown on the button.
widgets.headers.DropDownButton1.div_clas: CSS class of the inner div containing the links.
widgets.headers.DropDownButton1.link_cla: CSS Class applied to each link.
widgets.headers.DropDownButton1.nav_link: A list of lists, each inner list describing a link.

A list of lists, each inner list describing a link, the name of this field is used in the widgfield for any data returned in the get field
For each navigation link, the inner list elements are:
0 : The url, label or ident of the target page of the link
1 : The displayed text of the link
2 : If True, ident is appended to link even if there is no get field
3 : The get field data to send with the link
widgets.headers.HeadText: A tag which can be specified, (typically 'h1'), containing text.
widgets.headers.HeadText.large_text: The text appearing in the tag.
widgets.headers.HeadText.tag: The tag of the element, such as h1.
widgets.headers.HeaderErrorPara: A paragraph containing error text - normally hidden, displayed on error.
widgets.headers.HeaderErrorPara.hide: If True, hides the widget, can be set/unset via JSON. On error the value is overridden and the widget is shown.
widgets.headers.HeaderText1: A div containing h1 text, followed by a paragraph of text, and a normally hidden error paragraph.  The h1 and p text are JSON settable.
widgets.headers.HeaderText1.error_class: The CSS class applied to the normally hidden div containing an error paragraph.
widgets.headers.HeaderText1.h_class: CSS class for the H1 tag.
widgets.headers.HeaderText1.h_style: CSS style for the H1 tag.
widgets.headers.HeaderText1.large_text: The text within the H1 tags, JSON settable.
widgets.headers.HeaderText1.show_error: Default error text in the error paragraph, replaced by the error message when the widget displays an error.
widgets.headers.HeaderText1.small_text: The text within the p tags, JSON settable.
widgets.headers.HeaderText2: A div containing h2 text, followed by a paragraph of text, and a normally hidden error paragraph.  The h2 and p text are JSON settable.
widgets.headers.HeaderText2.error_class: The CSS class applied to the normally hidden div containing an error paragraph.
widgets.headers.HeaderText2.h_class: CSS class for the H2 tag.
widgets.headers.HeaderText2.h_style: CSS style for the H2 tag.
widgets.headers.HeaderText2.large_text: The text within the H2 tags, JSON settable.
widgets.headers.HeaderText2.show_error: Default error text in the error paragraph, replaced by the error message when the widget displays an error.
widgets.headers.HeaderText2.small_text: The text within the p tags, JSON settable.
widgets.headers.HeaderText3: A div containing h3 text, followed by a paragraph of text, and a normally hidden error paragraph.  The h3 and p text are JSON settable.
widgets.headers.HeaderText3.error_class: The CSS class applied to the normally hidden div containing an error paragraph.
widgets.headers.HeaderText3.h_class: CSS class for the H3 tag.
widgets.headers.HeaderText3.h_style: CSS style for the H3 tag.
widgets.headers.HeaderText3.large_text: The text within the H3 tags, JSON settable.
widgets.headers.HeaderText3.show_error: Default error text in the error paragraph, replaced by the error message when the widget displays an error.
widgets.headers.HeaderText3.small_text: The text within the p tags, JSON settable.
widgets.headers.HeaderText4: A div containing h4 text, followed by a paragraph of text, and a normally hidden error paragraph.  The h4 and p text are JSON settable.
widgets.headers.HeaderText4.error_class: The CSS class applied to the normally hidden div containing an error paragraph.
widgets.headers.HeaderText4.h_class: CSS class for the H4 tag.
widgets.headers.HeaderText4.h_style: CSS style for the H4 tag.
widgets.headers.HeaderText4.large_text: The text within the H4 tags, JSON settable.
widgets.headers.HeaderText4.show_error: Default error text in the error paragraph, replaced by the error message when the widget displays an error.
widgets.headers.HeaderText4.small_text: The text within the p tags, JSON settable.
widgets.headers.HeaderText5: A div containing h5 text, followed by a paragraph of text, and a normally hidden error paragraph.  The h5 and p text are JSON settable.
widgets.headers.HeaderText5.error_class: The CSS class applied to the normally hidden div containing an error paragraph.
widgets.headers.HeaderText5.h_class: CSS class for the H5 tag.
widgets.headers.HeaderText5.h_style: CSS style for the H5 tag.
widgets.headers.HeaderText5.large_text: The text within the H5 tags, JSON settable.
widgets.headers.HeaderText5.show_error: Default error text in the error paragraph, replaced by the error message when the widget displays an error.
widgets.headers.HeaderText5.small_text: The text within the p tags, JSON settable.
widgets.headers.HeaderText6: A div containing h6 text, followed by a paragraph of text, and a normally hidden error paragraph.  The h6 and p text are JSON settable.
widgets.headers.HeaderText6.error_class: The CSS class applied to the normally hidden div containing an error paragraph.
widgets.headers.HeaderText6.h_class: CSS class for the H6 tag.
widgets.headers.HeaderText6.h_style: CSS style for the H6 tag.
widgets.headers.HeaderText6.large_text: The text within the H6 tags, JSON settable.
widgets.headers.HeaderText6.show_error: Default error text in the error paragraph, replaced by the error message when the widget displays an error.
widgets.headers.HeaderText6.small_text: The text within the p tags, JSON settable.
widgets.headers.NavButtons1: A div, with a normally hidden error paragraph followed by a list of navigation buttons.
widgets.headers.NavButtons1.button_class: The CSS class of the button links.
widgets.headers.NavButtons1.error_class: The CSS class of the normally hidden div holding the error paragraph.
widgets.headers.NavButtons1.li_class: The CSS class of the li elements.
widgets.headers.NavButtons1.nav_links: A list of lists. Each inner list describing a link, the name of this field is used as the widgfield for any data returned in the get field of the links.
widgets.headers.NavButtons1.nav_links.fu:
A list of lists. Each inner list describing a link, the name of this field is used as the widgfield for any data returned in the get field of the links.

Each inner list should have four elements:

 0 : The url, label or ident of the target page of the link
 1 : The displayed text of the link
 2 : If True, ident_data is sent with the link even if there is no get field data
 3 : The get field data to send with the link
widgets.headers.NavButtons1.ul_class: The CSS class of the ul elements.
widgets.headers.NavButtons2: Defines a div, containing multiple navigation button links.
widgets.headers.NavButtons2.button_class: The CSS class of the button links.
widgets.headers.NavButtons2.button_style: The CSS style set on the button links.
widgets.headers.NavButtons2.nav_links: A list of lists, each inner list describing a link.
widgets.headers.NavButtons2.nav_links.fu:
A list of lists, each inner list describing a link, the name of this field is used in the widgfield for any data returned in the get field
For each navigation link, the inner list elements are:
0 : The url, label or ident of the target page of the link
1 : The displayed text of the link
2 : If True, ident is appended to link even if there is no get field
3 : The get field data to send with the link
widgets.headers.NavButtons3: Defines a div, containing multiple navigation button links, with JSON setting capabilities.
widgets.headers.NavButtons3.button_class: A list of CSS class strings, each item to be set on a button link.
widgets.headers.NavButtons3.button_style: The CSS style set on all the button links.
widgets.headers.NavButtons3.button_text: A list of text strings to be set on the buttons, the list length determines the number of buttons.
A list of text strings to be set on the buttons, the list length determines the number of buttons. When updating by JSON, the list length must match the existing list.
widgets.headers.NavButtons3.get_field1: A list of get fields of the links. JSON settable.
widgets.headers.NavButtons3.get_field1.f: This field value is submitted as get data with the link. The field name becomes part of the widgfield submitted. When setting by JSON, a None item in the list does not change the current field on the page
widgets.headers.NavButtons3.get_field2: A second list of get fields of the link. JSON settable
widgets.headers.NavButtons3.get_field2.f: This field value is submitted as get data with the link. The field name becomes part of the widgfield submitted. When setting by JSON, a None item in the list does not change the current field on the page
widgets.headers.NavButtons3.json_ident: If given, the url, ident or label to link, expecting a json file to be returned.
widgets.headers.NavButtons3.link_ident: The url, ident or label these buttons links to, if json_ident is not given, or the client does not have javascript enabled. Expects an HTML page to be returned.
widgets.headers.TabButtons1: A div, containing tab buttons which can hide/display portions of the page.
widgets.headers.TabButtons1.active_butto: The button index (starting at 0) of the button which is currently active.
The button index (starting at 0) of the button which is currently active. Can be set by JSON, if the index is out of range, no button will be active, and all associated page elements will be hidden.
widgets.headers.TabButtons1.button_class: The CSS class of the buttons.
widgets.headers.TabButtons1.hide_class: CSS class applied to page elements normally hidden.
widgets.headers.TabButtons1.hide_class.f: The CSS class given here should be set on those page elements to be controlled. Normally all such elements will be hidden, and will only be displayed when an appropriate tab button is pressed.
widgets.headers.TabButtons1.onclick_addc: CSS class to add to a button when it is clicked.
widgets.headers.TabButtons1.onclick_remo: CSS class to remove from a button when it is clicked.
widgets.headers.TabButtons1.tabs: A list of lists, each inner list being (button text, id of item to display).
widgets.headers.TabButtons1.tabs.full:
A list of lists, an inner list being supplied for each button. Each inner list has two elements:
0 - The text to appear on the button
1 - The id of the item to display when the button is pressed.
widgets.headers.module: Widgets to be typically used in a page header section.
widgets.info.PageDescription: A widget containing the page brief description of the given ident which is set within the text. If no page ident is given, shows the brief of the current page.
widgets.info.PageDescription.page_ident: The ident of a page or folder, the brief description of this item will be displayed.
widgets.info.PageDescription.span_text: Any text set here will override the page description. JSON settable.
widgets.info.PageIdent: A span displaying the ident of the page containing the widget. The ident can be overwriiten if the field page_ident is given a value.
widgets.info.PageIdent.page_ident: Normally left empty, but if set to a tuple 'projectname',pagenumber it will display those values.
widgets.info.PageIdent.span_text: If given, overrides the page_ident value, JSON settable.
widgets.info.PageName: A widget containing the name of the given page ident which is set within the text. If no page ident is given, shows name of the current page.
widgets.info.PageName.page_ident: The ident of a page or folder.
widgets.info.PageName.span_text: If given, overrides the page name, JSON settable.
widgets.info.ProgressBar1: A div, containing label and progress tag elements.
widgets.info.ProgressBar1.label: Label text shown to the left of the progress bar.
widgets.info.ProgressBar1.label_class: The CSS class of the label tag.
widgets.info.ProgressBar1.label_style: The CSS style of the label tag.
widgets.info.ProgressBar1.max: Maximum numerical value for the bar.
widgets.info.ProgressBar1.progress_class: The CSS class applied to the progress tag.
widgets.info.ProgressBar1.progress_style: The CSS style applied to the progress tag
widgets.info.ProgressBar1.text: A text value shown if the browser does not support the progress tag. JSON settable.
widgets.info.ProgressBar1.value: The value attribute of the progress tag, which sets the bar length, JSON settable.
widgets.info.ProjectName: A span showing the name of the project the page is in.
widgets.info.Redirector:
A widget containing javascript which redirects the page to the given url.
Once the page is loaded, the redirection occurs, so normally this is the only widget on the page.
A TextBlock is displayed with the link to the url if the client has javascript disabled.
widgets.info.Redirector.text_refnotfound: If the TextBlock is not found, this text is used instead.
widgets.info.Redirector.text_replacebloc: If text is set here, it will be used instead of a TextBlock.
widgets.info.Redirector.textblock_ref: The reference of a TextBlock which is displayed with the link to the url if the client has javascript disabled.
widgets.info.Redirector.url:
The external URL to which this widget will redirect.
Should include the http:// prefix.
widgets.info.ServerTimeStamp: A span containing the server date and time.
widgets.info.ServerTimeStamp.timestamp: Normally empty, any text given here will replace the automatically generated timestamp. JSON settable.
widgets.info.ServerTimeStamp.utc: If True, time is UTC, if False it is server local time
widgets.info.SkipoleVersion: A span showing the version of the skipole framework.
widgets.info.Version: A span showing the project version of the page it is in.
widgets.info.module: Widgets which display information - for example timestamp, page ident, etc.
widgets.inputforms.Form1: A form, initially without content, used to contain further input fields and submit button.
widgets.inputforms.Form1.action: The page ident, label or url this form links to.
widgets.inputforms.Form1.container0: This widget is a form, which normally submits one or more input fields. You can insert further input widgets and html here.
widgets.inputforms.Form1.container_class: The CSS class attribute of the div tag of the container holding further elements.
widgets.inputforms.Form1.enctype: If given, sets the enctype attribute.
widgets.inputforms.Form1.error_class: CSS class applied to a normally hidden div which appears if an error is displayed by the widget.
widgets.inputforms.Form1.hidden_field1: A hidden field value, leave blank if unused.
widgets.inputforms.Form1.hidden_field2: A second hidden field value, leave blank if unused.
widgets.inputforms.Form1.hidden_field3: A third hidden field value, leave blank if unused.
widgets.inputforms.Form1.hidden_field4: A fourth hidden field value, leave blank if unused.
widgets.inputforms.HiddenField: An input field of type hidden, typically inserted into forms, the value can be set by JSON.
widgets.inputforms.HiddenField.hidden_fi: This field value is the 'value' attribute of this input field to be sent when the enclosing form is submitted.

Typically this widget is included in a form, and the value of this field is the value returned to the server when the form is submitted. The value can be set here, or via a Responder, or by a JSON call.
widgets.inputforms.HiddenLocalStorage: An input field of type hidden, typically inserted into forms, the value taken from browser local storage.
widgets.inputforms.HiddenLocalStorage.lo: The local storage key which specifies the value to be submitted in the field. JSON settable.
widgets.inputforms.HiddenSessionStorage: An input field of type hidden, typically inserted into forms, the value taken from browser session storage.
The session storage key which specifies the value to be submitted in the field. JSON settable.
widgets.inputforms.SubmitButton1: An input field of type submit, with name attribute, for use as an insert into form widgets
widgets.inputforms.SubmitButton1.button_: Submitted with the value attribute as the button text, and the name attribute being the 'button_text' widgfield.
widgets.inputforms.SubmitButton2: An input field of type submit, no name, so does not submit a widgfield, for use as an insert into form widgets
widgets.inputforms.SubmitButton2.button_: Button with value of the "button_text" value, but no name, so does not submit a widgfield.
widgets.inputforms.SubmitForm1:
A form taking contents with submit button and four hidden fields - generally used with
further input fields set within it.
widgets.inputforms.SubmitForm1.action: The form destination - a responder page ident or label. This is called if action_json is not set, or if the client does not have javascript enabled. A full HTML page should be returned.
widgets.inputforms.SubmitForm1.action.fu: This field sets the 'action' attribute of the form tag. Either a responder page ident, or page label (if the target responder page has been given a label) should be input here, and at run time this will be converted to the correct URL.  Normally you would set the action to call a responder page - or the first in a series of responders, that check the correct fields have been submitted, validates them, stores the results in the call_data dictionary, then submits the data to your code.
widgets.inputforms.SubmitForm1.action_js: If a value set, and the client has javascript enabled, this is the page ident or label this form calls, expects a json page back.
widgets.inputforms.SubmitForm1.button_cl: The CSS class of the submit button.
widgets.inputforms.SubmitForm1.button_te: The text on the submit button.
widgets.inputforms.SubmitForm1.button_wa: Text placed on button once submitted.
widgets.inputforms.SubmitForm1.container: Content can be placed immediately within the form tag (after the hidden error div), generally useful for setting input fields, which will be submitted with the form.
The CSS class attribute of the div tag of the container holding further elements.
widgets.inputforms.SubmitForm1.div_class: The CSS class attribute of the div tag which contains the label and button.
widgets.inputforms.SubmitForm1.enctype: If given, Sets the enctype attribute.
widgets.inputforms.SubmitForm1.error_cla: The CSS class applied to the paragraph containing the error message on error.
widgets.inputforms.SubmitForm1.hidden_fi: A hidden field value, leave blank if unused, this field name is used as the submitted field name
A second hidden field value, leave blank if unused, this field name is used as the submitted field name
A third hidden field value, leave blank if unused, this field name is used as the submitted field name
A fourth hidden field value, leave blank if unused, this field name is used as the submitted field name
widgets.inputforms.SubmitForm1.left_clas: The class attribute of the left_label
widgets.inputforms.SubmitForm1.left_labe: The label appearing adjacent and to the left of the submit button
widgets.inputforms.SubmitForm1.left_styl: The style attribute of the left_label
widgets.inputforms.SubmitForm1.right_cla: The class attribute of the right_label
widgets.inputforms.SubmitForm1.right_lab: The label appearing adjacent and to the right of the submit button
widgets.inputforms.SubmitForm1.right_sty: The style attribute of the right_label
widgets.inputforms.SubmitForm2: A form taking contents with submit button and four hidden fields, also given storage keys returns the local or session storage values - generally used with further input fields set within it.
widgets.inputforms.SubmitForm2.action: The form destination - a responder page ident or label. This is called if action_json is not set, or if the client does not have javascript enabled. A full HTML page should be returned.
widgets.inputforms.SubmitForm2.action.fu: This field sets the 'action' attribute of the form tag. Either a responder page ident, or page label (if the target responder page has been given a label) should be input here, and at run time this will be converted to the correct URL.  Normally you would set the action to call a responder page - or the first in a series of responders, that check the correct fields have been submitted, validates them, stores the results in the call_data dictionary, then submits the data to your code.
widgets.inputforms.SubmitForm2.action_js: If a value set, and the client has javascript enabled, this is the page ident or label this form calls, expects a json page back.
widgets.inputforms.SubmitForm2.button_cl: The CSS class of the submit button.
widgets.inputforms.SubmitForm2.button_te: The text on the submit button.
widgets.inputforms.SubmitForm2.button_wa: Text placed on button once submitted.
widgets.inputforms.SubmitForm2.container: Content can be placed immediately within the form tag (after the hidden error div), generally useful for setting input fields, which will be submitted with the form.
The CSS class attribute of the div tag of the container holding further elements.
widgets.inputforms.SubmitForm2.div_class: The CSS class attribute of the div tag which contains the label and button.
widgets.inputforms.SubmitForm2.enctype: If given, Sets the enctype attribute.
widgets.inputforms.SubmitForm2.error_cla: The CSS class applied to the paragraph containing the error message on error.
widgets.inputforms.SubmitForm2.hidden_fi: A hidden field value, leave blank if unused, this field name is used as the submitted field name
A second hidden field value, leave blank if unused, this field name is used as the submitted field name
A third hidden field value, leave blank if unused, this field name is used as the submitted field name
A fourth hidden field value, leave blank if unused, this field name is used as the submitted field name
widgets.inputforms.SubmitForm2.left_clas: The class attribute of the left_label
widgets.inputforms.SubmitForm2.left_labe: The label appearing adjacent and to the left of the submit button
widgets.inputforms.SubmitForm2.left_styl: The style attribute of the left_label
widgets.inputforms.SubmitForm2.local_sto: A local storage key, this widgfield returns the stored value if anything
widgets.inputforms.SubmitForm2.right_cla: The class attribute of the right_label
widgets.inputforms.SubmitForm2.right_lab: The label appearing adjacent and to the right of the submit button
widgets.inputforms.SubmitForm2.right_sty: The style attribute of the right_label
widgets.inputforms.SubmitForm2.session_s: A session storage key, this widgfield returns the stored value if anything
widgets.inputforms.module: Various input forms, with submit buttons.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable1: A three column table of two text columns and a text input column. Without a form or submit button, typically included within a form.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable1.col1: A list of text strings, to be placed in the first column.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable1.col1.ful: A list of text strings, to be placed in the first column. When updating by JSON, the list must have the same number of elements as rows in the table. Any element set to None, will not be changed
widgets.inputtables.InputTable1.col2: A list of text strings, to be placed in the second column.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable1.col2.ful: A list of text strings, to be placed in the second column. When updating by JSON, the list must have the same number of elements as rows in the table. Any element set to None, will not be changed
widgets.inputtables.InputTable1.full: A three column table of two text columns and a checkbox column. Without a form or submit button, typically included within a form. A dictionary should be set with the inputdict field, with a key:value for each row of the table. When submitted the field will be returned with a dictionary of keynames:values for those keys with values.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable1.header_c: The CSS class of the header row, if empty string, then no class will be applied.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable1.inputdic: A dictionary of keynames:values for the input fields of the third column.

A dictionary of keynames:values for the input fields of the third column. This field name is used as part of the widgfield returned. The returned data will be a dictionary of keynames:values for those keys with values. When updating by JSON, any value set to None will be unchanged.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable1.maxlengt: The maximum number of characters accepted in each text area.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable1.row_clas: A list of CSS classes, each to be applied to a table row (not including the header row).
widgets.inputtables.InputTable1.size: The number of characters appearing in each text input area.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable1.title1: The header title string over the first column.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable1.title2: The header title string over the second column.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable1.title3: The header title string over the third (inputs) column.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable3: A table of four columns, two being text strings, one a text input field, the fourth being a cell with up and down arrow links
widgets.inputtables.InputTable3.col1: A list of text strings, to be placed in the first column.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable3.col1.ful: A list of text strings, to be placed in the first column. When updating by JSON, the list must have the same number of elements as rows in the table. Any element set to None, will not be changed
widgets.inputtables.InputTable3.col1_cla: CSS class applied to every td in the first column.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable3.col2: A list of text strings, to be placed in the second column.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable3.col2.ful: A list of text strings, to be placed in the second column. When updating by JSON, the list must have the same number of elements as rows in the table. Any element set to None, will not be changed
widgets.inputtables.InputTable3.col2_cla: CSS class applied to every td in the second column.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable3.col3_cla: CSS class applied to every td in the third column.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable3.col4_cla: CSS class applied to every td in the fourth column.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable3.col4_sty: CSS style applied to every td in the fourth column.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable3.down_cla: CSS class applied to the down arrow links.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable3.down_get: List of get field values, one for each down arrow link.
List of get field values, one for each down arrow link. When updating by JSON, any value set to None will be unchanged.
List of second get field values, one for each down arrow link.
List of second get field values, one for each down arrow link. When updating by JSON, any value set to None will be unchanged.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable3.down_hid: List of True/False to hide or not hide the down arrow links.
List of True/False to hide or not hide the down arrow links. When updating by JSON, any value set to None will be unchanged.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable3.down_jso: ident of the down arrow link, expects a json file returned.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable3.down_lin: ident of the down arrow link, to be called if javascript is disabled
widgets.inputtables.InputTable3.down_sty: CSS style applied to the down arrow links.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable3.full: A table of four columns, two being text strings, one a text input field, the fourth being a cell with up and down arrow links. On the links being chosen a request for a json update is made, which typically updates the text columns, and the values in the input fields. Each arrow has two get fields which can be set. The first row is four header titles. The widget is typically inserted into a form, which can then send the input field values.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable3.getfield: Set on both arrows as getfield3 and will follow the values set on the input field.

A list of values, one for each row, which will be set on both arrows as getfield3 and will follow the values set on the input field. Normally leave empty, and only set when doing a JSON update. Setting inputdict overrides values set here. Setting values to None means no change. When a user types in the input field, these get fields on the link will be set by javascript to whatever new value has been input. So a link submission will always give the input field content.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable3.header_c: The CSS class of the header row, if empty string, then no class will be applied.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable3.input_cl: The CSS class applied to every input field in the third column.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable3.input_st: The CSS style applied to every input field in the third column.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable3.inputdic: A dictionary of keynames:values for the input fields.

A dictionary of keynames:values for the input fields. This field name is used as part of the widgfield returned. The returned data will be a dictionary of keynames:values for those keys with values. When updating by JSON, any value set to None will be unchanged.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable3.maxlengt: The maximum number of characters accepted in each text input field.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable3.row_clas: A list of CSS classes, each to be applied to a table row (not including the header row).
A list of CSS classes, each to be applied to a table row (not including the header row). When updating by JSON, any value set to None will be unchanged.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable3.size: The number of characters appearing in each text input field,
widgets.inputtables.InputTable3.title1: The header title string over the first column.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable3.title2: The header title string over the second column.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable3.title3: The header title string over the third column.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable3.title4: The header title string over the fourth (arrows) column.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable3.up_class: CSS class applied to the up arrow links.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable3.up_getfi: List of get field values, one for each up arrow link.
List of get field values, one for each up arrow link. When updating by JSON, any value set to None will be unchanged.
List of second get field values, one for each up arrow link.
List of second get field values, one for each up arrow link. When updating by JSON, any value set to None will be unchanged.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable3.up_hide: List of True/False to hide or not hide the up arrow links.
List of True/False to hide or not hide the up arrow links. When updating by JSON, any value set to None will be unchanged.
widgets.inputtables.InputTable3.up_json_: ident of the up arrow link, expects a json file returned.

widgets.links.Table2_Links.col1: A list of text strings to be placed in the first column.
widgets.links.Table2_Links.col1_class: CSS class applied to every td in the first column.
widgets.links.Table2_Links.col2: A list of link text strings to be placed in the second column.
widgets.links.Table2_Links.col2_class: CSS class applied to every td in the second column.
widgets.links.Table2_Links.col2_getfield: A list of get fields for the second column.
widgets.links.Table2_Links.col2_json_ide: A list of links for the second column. Requests a json page to be returned.

widgets.links.Table2_Links.col2_link_ide: A list of links for the second column. Sets the number of table rows displayed.
A list of links for the second column, called if the corresponding item in col2_json_idents is empty. If a link item is empty, the table cell will have text only.
widgets.links.Table2_Links.even_class: CSS class of even rows, if empty no class will be applied.
widgets.links.Table2_Links.force_ident: If True, the page ident will be sent with the link, even if no get field is present.
widgets.links.Table2_Links.header_class: CSS class of the table header row.
widgets.links.Table2_Links.link_classes: A list of CSS classes to apply to the links.
widgets.links.Table2_Links.link_styles: A list of CSS styles to apply to the links.
widgets.links.Table2_Links.odd_class: CSS class of odd rows, if empty no class will be applied.
widgets.links.Table2_Links.title1: The header title over the text column.
widgets.links.Table2_Links.title2: The header title over the links column.
widgets.links.Table3_Buttons2: A table of three text columns and two button link columns.
widgets.links.Table3_Buttons2.button_cla: The CSS class to apply to the buttons.
widgets.links.Table3_Buttons2.button_tex: Text on the first link button column.
Text on the second link button column.
widgets.links.Table3_Buttons2.button_wai: Text shown on button1 when pressed
Text shown on button2 when pressed
widgets.links.Table3_Buttons2.contents: List of lists - each inner list describing a row.
widgets.links.Table3_Buttons2.contents.f:
List of lists - each inner list describing a row.
Index 0, 1 and 2 is the text to place in the first three columns,
Index 3, 4 is the two get field contents of the first link,
Index 5, 6 is the two get field contents of the second link.
Index 7 - True if the first button and link is to be shown, False if not.
Index 8 - True if the second button and link is to be shown, False if not
widgets.links.Table3_Buttons2.even_class: CSS class of even rows, if empty no class will be applied.

The field name is the name (not value) of the get field 2 of the first link, value is True if get field exists, False if not
widgets.links.Table3_Buttons2.get_field2: The field name is the name (not value) of the get field 1 of the second link, value is True if get field exists, False if not
The field name is the name (not value) of the get field 2 of the second link, value is True if get field exists, False if not
widgets.links.Table3_Buttons2.header_cla: CSS class of the table header row.
widgets.links.Table3_Buttons2.json_ident: The url, ident or label for the first column of buttons, requires a json file to be returned.
The url, ident or label for the second column of buttons, requires a json file to be returned.
widgets.links.Table3_Buttons2.link_ident: HTML link used for the first column of buttons, if json_ident not given, or if javascript not available.
HTML link used for the second column of buttons, if json_ident not given, or if javascript not available.
widgets.links.Table3_Buttons2.odd_class: CSS class of odd rows, if empty no class will be applied.
widgets.links.Table3_Buttons2.title1: The header title over the first text column.
widgets.links.Table3_Buttons2.title2: The header title over the second text column.
widgets.links.Table3_Buttons2.title3: The header title over the third text column.
widgets.links.module: Links, including links to page idents, and tables of links with get fields and link text.
widgets.lists.UList1: A UL list with JSON settable text content.
widgets.lists.UList1.contents: List of text strings, each being a li element content.
widgets.lists.UList1.contents.full: List of text strings, each being a li element content. Can be set by JSON, any text content is escaped, but new lines are converted to br tags.

widgets.lists.UList1.odd_class: CSS class applied to each odd li element.
widgets.lists.UList2: A UL list with JSON settable html content.

widgets.lists.UList2.odd_class: CSS class applied to each odd li element.
widgets.lists.UList2.set_html: List of html strings, each being a li element content.
widgets.lists.UList2.set_html.full: List of html strings, each being a li element content. Can be set by JSON, the strings are not escaped.
widgets.lists.module: Lists, including unordered and ordered lists with JSON settable content.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1: A form with input text and password fields, a submit button and four hidden fields.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.action: The form destination, if action_json not set - either a responder page ident or label.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.action.full: This field sets the 'action' attribute of the form tag. Either a responder page ident, or page label (if the target responder page has been given a label) should be input here, and at run time this will be converted to the correct URL.  Normally you would set the action to call a responder page - or the first in a series of responders, that check the correct fields have been submitted, validates them, stores the results in the call_data dictionary, then submits the data to your code.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.action_json: The form destination - either a responder page ident or label, requires JSON page returned.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.button_class: The class of the submit button.
The class of the submit button. This gives the opportunity to define a button via CSS.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.button_style: The style of the submit button.
The style of the submit button. This gives the opportunity to define a button via CSS.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.disabled1: If True, the first input field will be disabled.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.disabled2: If True, the password input field will be disabled.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.div1_class: CSS Class applied to div surrounding the first text input field and label.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.div2_class: CSS Class applied to div surrounding the password input field and label.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.div3_class: CSS Class applied to div surrounding the form submit button.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.error_class: The class applied to the div containing the error message on error.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.error_class.f: The class applied to the normally hidden div containing the paragraph and error message. On error this div is displayed.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.hidden_field1: A hidden field value, leave blank if unused, this field name is used as the submitted field name
A hidden field value, leave blank if unused, this field name is used as the submitted field name
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.hidden_field2: A second hidden field value, leave blank if unused, this field name is used as the submitted field name
A second hidden field value, leave blank if unused, this field name is used as the submitted field name
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.hidden_field3: A third hidden field value, leave blank if unused, this field name is used as the submitted field name
A third hidden field value, leave blank if unused, this field name is used as the submitted field name
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.hidden_field4: A fourth hidden field value, leave blank if unused, this field name is used as the submitted field name
A fourth hidden field value, leave blank if unused, this field name is used as the submitted field name
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.input_accepte: Class to be set on an input field if set_input_accepted1 or 2 is True.
Class to be set on an input field if the appropriate set_input_accepted1 or 2 is True. Typically used to show an input has been submitted and accepted ok, such as a green border.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.input_class1: CSS Class set on the first input field.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.input_class2: CSS Class set on the password input field.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.input_errored: Class to be set on an input field if set_input_errored1 or 2 is True.
Class to be set on an input field if the appropriate set_input_errored1 or 2 is True. Typically used to show that a submitted value is in error, such as a red border.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.input_text1: The name of the first input text field, with default value.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.input_text1.f: The name of the first input text field, set the value of this field to the default value shown in the field, the user will change this value which will then be returned. Validators can be added to this field.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.input_text2: The name of the password input field, with default value.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.input_text2.f: The name of the password input field, set the value of this field to the default value shown in the field, the user will change this value which will then be returned. Validators can be added to this field.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.inputdiv_clas: The class of the div containing label, input fields and submit button.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.label1: The text displayed to the left of the first input text field.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.label1.full: The text displayed to the left of the first input text field within a 'label' tag. If no text is given no label tag is created.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.label2: The text displayed to the left of the password input field.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.label2.full: The text displayed to the left of the password input field within a 'label' tag. If no text is given no label tag is created.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.label_class1: The css class of the label to the left of the first input text field.
The css class of the label to the left of the first input text field.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.label_class2: The css class of the label to the left of the password input field.
The css class of the label to the left of the password input field.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.label_style1: The css style of the label to the left of the first input text field.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.label_style2: The css style of the label to the left of the password input field.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.maxlength1: The maximum number of characters accepted in the first text input field.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.maxlength1.fu: The maximum number of characters accepted in the first text input field.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.maxlength2: The maximum number of characters accepted in the password input field.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.maxlength2.fu: The maximum number of characters accepted in the password input field.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.pattern1: If the browser supports this feature, a regular expression pattern will be tested against the first input field.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.pattern2: If the browser supports this feature, a regular expression pattern will be tested against the password input field.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.required1: Set True to put the 'required' attribute into the first input field.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.required1.ful: Set True to put the 'required' attribute into the first input field.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.required2: Set True to put the 'required' attribute into the password input field.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.required2.ful: Set True to put the 'required' attribute into the password input field.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.set_input_acc: If True, input_accepted_class will be set on the first input field.
If True, input_accepted_class will be set on the password input field.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.set_input_err: If True, input_errored_class will be set on the first input field.
If True, input_errored_class will be set on the password input field.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.size1: The number of characters appearing in the first text input field.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.size1.full: The number of characters appearing in the first text input field.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.size2: The number of characters appearing in the password input field.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.size2.full: The number of characters appearing in the password input field.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.title1: Text shown if the pattern regular expression does not match in the first text input field.
widgets.logins.NamePasswd1.title2: Text shown if the pattern regular expression does not match in the password input field.
widgets.logins.Pin4: Defines a form containing four single character input fields.
widgets.logins.Pin4.action: The target ident or label called when the form is submitted.
widgets.logins.Pin4.autofocus: If True these PIN fields get focus on the page being loaded.
widgets.logins.Pin4.butt_div_class: The CSS class of the div containing the submit button and label.
widgets.logins.Pin4.button_class: The CSS class of the submit input field.
widgets.logins.Pin4.button_text: The text on the submit button.
widgets.logins.Pin4.char_div_class: The CSS class of the div containing the four input PIN fields.
widgets.logins.Pin4.char_div_style: The CSS style of the div containing the four input PIN fields.
widgets.logins.Pin4.error_class: The CSS class applied to a normally hidden div appearing above the form. The div contains an error paragraph and is shown when the widget displays an error message.
widgets.logins.Pin4.hidden_field1: A hidden field value, leave blank if unused,  the field name is used in the submitted widgfield.
widgets.logins.Pin4.hidden_field2: A second hidden field value, leave blank if unused,  the field name is used in the submitted widgfield.
widgets.logins.Pin4.hidden_field3: A third hidden field value, leave blank if unused,  the field name is used in the submitted widgfield.
widgets.logins.Pin4.hidden_field4: A fourth hidden field value, leave blank if unused,  the field name is used in the submitted widgfield.
widgets.logins.Pin4.hide: If True, the widget is hidden, normally set to False to display the widget, can be set by JSON.
widgets.logins.Pin4.inner_div_class: CSS Class set on an inner div containing the error message and form, contained within the widget div. May be useful if a modal widget is required.
widgets.logins.Pin4.left_class: CSS class set on a label to the left of the submit button.
widgets.logins.Pin4.left_label: Label text set on the left of the submit button.
widgets.logins.Pin4.left_style: CSS style set on the label to the left of the submit button.
widgets.logins.Pin4.pin1: If True, the pin1 field is enabled, if False the field is disabled with an 'X' inserted. The field name is used as the widgfield name for the submitted value.
widgets.logins.Pin4.pin2: If True, the pin2 field is enabled, if False the field is disabled with an 'X' inserted. The field name is used as the widgfield name for the submitted value.
widgets.logins.Pin4.pin3: If True, the pin3 field is enabled, if False the field is disabled with an 'X' inserted. The field name is used as the widgfield name for the submitted value.
widgets.logins.Pin4.pin4: If True, the pin4 field is enabled, if False the field is disabled with an 'X' inserted. The field name is used as the widgfield name for the submitted value.
widgets.logins.Pin4.right_class: CSS class set on a label to the right of the submit button.
widgets.logins.Pin4.right_label: Label text set on the right of the submit button.
widgets.logins.Pin4.right_style: CSS style set on the label to the right of the submit button.
widgets.paras.DivHTML: A div, containing a string, which will be set as html, without escaping. Hide, drag and drop can be set.
widgets.paras.DivHTML.drag: If given this is text data sent with a JSON request call when this item is dropped. If nothing set here, this item will not be draggable.
widgets.paras.DivHTML.drop: If given this is text data sent with a JSON request call when another item is dropped here. If nothing set here, this item will not be droppable.
widgets.paras.DivHTML.dropident: The ident or label of target which should return a JSON page, called when a drop occurs here.
widgets.paras.DivHTML.set_html: The string, containing html characters, which will be set within the div. JSON settable.
widgets.paras.DivPara: A div containing a paragraph, containing text, if an error is raised, then the text is changed for the error message and the error_class given to the paragraph.
widgets.paras.DivPara.error_class: The CSS class given to the paragraph when an error is displayed. Replaces para_class.
widgets.paras.DivPara.para_class: The CSS class applied to the paragraph.
widgets.paras.DivPara.para_text: The text appearing in the paragraph, can be set by JSON. Replaced by the error message when the widget displays an error.
widgets.paras.DivPara.pre_line: If True, sets style="white-space: pre-line;" into the paragraph which preserves new line breaks in the text.
widgets.paras.DivStyleDiv: A div, containing an inner div or other tag, which can have a style set, and contains unescaped text, set as HTML.
widgets.paras.DivStyleDiv.inner_tag: The tag, such as div or p applied to the inner element.
widgets.paras.DivStyleDiv.set_html: An unescaped text string, displayed as HTML within the inner tag. JSON settable.
widgets.paras.DivStyleDiv.style: The style of the inner element.
widgets.paras.JSONDivLink: A div with button and inner div of content. If inner div is visible, it is hidden on link press. If hidden, a call is made.
widgets.paras.JSONDivLink.button_class: CSS class of the button link.
widgets.paras.JSONDivLink.button_class.f: CSS class of the button link.
widgets.paras.JSONDivLink.button_hide_te: Button text when content is visible.
Button text when content is visible, automatically set on the button by javascript when button pressed to display contents.
widgets.paras.JSONDivLink.button_show_te: Button text when content is hidden.
Button text when content is hidden.
Button text when content is hidden, automatically set on the button by javascript when button pressed to hide contents.
widgets.paras.JSONDivLink.div_class: CSS class of the content div.
widgets.paras.JSONDivLink.div_class.full: CSS class of the content div.
widgets.paras.JSONDivLink.div_content: Text or html string to place in the content div.
widgets.paras.JSONDivLink.div_content.fu: Text or html string to place in the content div. When a call is made to display the contents, this is normally returned (with hide set to False) by JSON to display the text or html.
widgets.paras.JSONDivLink.get_field: GET data to send when button is pressed.
widgets.paras.JSONDivLink.get_field.full: GET data to send when button is pressed.
widgets.paras.JSONDivLink.hide: Set True to hide the contents div, False to show it.
widgets.paras.JSONDivLink.hide.full: Normally initially set to True on a page to hide the contents div. When a call is made (button pressed to show contents) return hide set to False, and div_content with the text to display. When the button is pressed to toggle to hide again, no call is made as the text is hidden by javascript.
widgets.paras.JSONDivLink.htmlescaped: If True, any html in the content is escaped.
widgets.paras.JSONDivLink.htmlescaped.fu: If True, any html in the content is escaped.
widgets.paras.JSONDivLink.json_ident: label or ident of JSON page called to display content.
widgets.paras.JSONDivLink.json_ident.ful: label or ident of JSON page called to display content. Normally a responder which sets hide to False, and div_content to the required text, and passes this to general_json to be returned and displayed.
widgets.paras.JSONDivLink.link_ident: ident or label of page warning that javascript is needed.
widgets.paras.JSONDivLink.link_ident.ful: As this widget requires javascript, this ident or label should be to a page warning that javascript is needed. Will be called on button press if client browser does not have javascript enabled.
widgets.paras.JSONTextLink: A div containing an anchor link (used as a button) followed by a paragraph which is hidden when button pressed, or if already hidden, a JSON call is made which can set and display the paragraph.
widgets.paras.JSONTextLink.button_class: The CSS class set on the anchor tag. Used to describe the button to be pressed.
The CSS class to be set on the 'a' tag, generally used to describe how the button will look.
widgets.paras.JSONTextLink.button_hide_t: Text on the button when the paragraph is displayed, such as "Hide".
widgets.paras.JSONTextLink.button_show_t: Text on the button when the paragraph is hidden, such as "Show".
widgets.paras.JSONTextLink.get_field: Data to be sent with the button press - this field name is used in the widgfield.
widgets.paras.JSONTextLink.hide: If True, hides the paragraph (Note: Not the button). If False, shows it, JSON Enabled.
widgets.paras.JSONTextLink.hide.full:
Normally set to True here, which hides the paragraph (The button link will still be shown). If set to False, displays the paragraph.
Generally used when the button sends a JSON call, you should return the new text (if any) and also return this hide field with a False value to display the paragraph.
widgets.paras.JSONTextLink.json_ident: If the text is hidden and the button pressed an call is made to this target ident or label which should return a JSON file.
widgets.paras.JSONTextLink.json_ident.fu:
If the text is hidden and the button pressed an call is made to this target ident or label which should return a JSON file.
The returned file should have {(widgname,'para_text'):'new text to place in paragraph', (widgname,'hide'):False} to display the text and to set the button to 'button_hide_text'.
widgets.paras.JSONTextLink.link_ident: If the client has javascript disabled, then this target label or ident is called which should return a new html page.
widgets.paras.JSONTextLink.para_class: The CSS class applied to the paragraph.
widgets.paras.JSONTextLink.para_text: The text inserted in the paragraph. Can be set by JSON.
widgets.paras.JSONTextLink.pre_line: If True, sets style="white-space: pre-line;" into the paragraph which preserves new line breaks in the text.
widgets.paras.ParaText: A p tag, containing text. The text can be set by JSON.
widgets.paras.ParaText.para_text: The text of the paragraph. Can be set by JSON.
widgets.paras.PreText: Pre-formatted text placed between pre tags.
widgets.paras.PreText.pre_text: The text to place between the pre tags.
widgets.paras.ShowPara1: A div, containing a paragraph of text followed by an error paragraph. The text paragraph is normally visible (depending on the show_para field), the error paragraph is hidden, and becomes visible on error.
widgets.paras.ShowPara1.error_class: The CSS class of the normally hidden error paragraph.
widgets.paras.ShowPara1.para_class: The CSS class of the text paragraph.
widgets.paras.ShowPara1.para_text: Set this with the text to appear in the paragraph.  This can also be set via a JSON file.
widgets.paras.ShowPara1.pre_line: If True, sets style="white-space: pre-line;" into the paragraph which preserves new line breaks in the text.
widgets.paras.ShowPara1.show_error: The default error text to be displayed. If this is set into a PageData object it will cause the error paragraph to be displayed. Can be set by JSON file.
widgets.paras.ShowPara1.show_para: Set to True to display the paragraph, or False to hide it.  This can also be set via a JSON file.
widgets.paras.ShowPara2: A div, containing an x button which on pressed will hide it, and after the button, another div holding text.
widgets.paras.ShowPara2.close_class: The CSS class of the div holding the X close symbol.
widgets.paras.ShowPara2.close_style: The CSS style of the div holding the X close symbol.
widgets.paras.ShowPara2.hide: If True, hides the widget, JSON settable.
widgets.paras.ShowPara2.inner_class: CSS class of the inner div holding the text.
widgets.paras.ShowPara2.pre_line: If True, style "white-space: pre-line;" is set on the paragraph, which enables line spacing in the text.
widgets.paras.SpanText: A span tag, containing text. The text can be set by JSON.
widgets.paras.SpanText.span_text: The text appearing in the span, can be set by JSON.
widgets.paras.TagBlock: A general element, containing further content. CSS Class, style, hide, drag and drop can be set.
widgets.paras.TagBlock.container0: Further elements and widgets can be contained within this tagblock.
widgets.paras.TagBlock.drag: If given this is text data sent with a JSON request call when this item is dropped. If nothing set here, this item will not be draggable.
widgets.paras.TagBlock.drop: If given this is text data sent with a JSON request call when another item is dropped here. If nothing set here, this item will not be droppable.
widgets.paras.TagBlock.dropident: The ident or label of target which should return a JSON page, called when a drop occurs here.
widgets.paras.TagBlock.hide: If True, the element is hidden, JSON settable.
widgets.paras.TagBlock.tag: The tag of the element, such as div or p.
widgets.paras.TagText: A tag, which can be specified, containing text.
widgets.paras.TagText.hide: If True the widget is hidden, JSON settable.
widgets.paras.TagText.tag: The tag of the element, such as div or p.
widgets.paras.TagText.tag_text: The text in the element, JSON settable.
widgets.paras.TextBlockDiv: A div, containing a TextBlock. The content is not escaped, therefore useful for a TextBlock containing html.
widgets.paras.TextBlockDiv.content_refno: The content set here is displayed if the textblock reference is not found.
widgets.paras.TextBlockDiv.content_repla: If content is set here it will replace the TextBlock. It will be shown as unescaped html, and can be set by JSON.
widgets.paras.TextBlockDiv.textblock_pro: Set with a project name if the TextBlock is defined in a sub project.
widgets.paras.TextBlockDiv.textblock_ref: The reference string of the TextBlock to be set in the div.
widgets.paras.TextBlockPara: A paragraph, containing a TextBlock, the content is escaped and shown as text. If an error is raised, then the text is changed for the error_message.
widgets.paras.TextBlockPara.error_class: CSS class which replaces widget_class when this widget displays an error.
widgets.paras.TextBlockPara.linebreaks: Set True if linebreaks in the text are to be shown as html breaks.
widgets.paras.TextBlockPara.replace_stri: A list of strings, if given, will be used with the python % operator on the text (but not in the text_replaceblock).
widgets.paras.TextBlockPara.text_refnotf: The text to appear if the textblock is not found.
widgets.paras.TextBlockPara.text_replace: If given, any text set here will replace the TextBlock text. Can be set by JSON.
widgets.paras.TextBlockPara.textblock_pr: Set with a project name if the TextBlock is defined in a sub project.
widgets.paras.TextBlockPara.textblock_re: The reference string of the TextBlock appearing in the paragraph.
widgets.paras.module: Paragraphs, including paragraphs showing TextBlocks and error messages.

widgets.radio.BooleanRadio.div_class1.fu: Class of the first div containing the first radio button
widgets.radio.BooleanRadio.div_class2: Class of the second div containing the second radio button
widgets.radio.BooleanRadio.div_class2.fu: Class of the second div containing the second radio button
widgets.radio.BooleanRadio.left_class1: The css class of the label to the left of the first radio button
widgets.radio.BooleanRadio.left_class1.f: The css class of the label to the left of the first radio button
widgets.radio.BooleanRadio.left_class2: The css class of the label to the left of the second radio button
widgets.radio.BooleanRadio.left_class2.f: The css class of the label to the left of the second radio button
widgets.radio.BooleanRadio.left_label1: The text displayed to the left of the first radio button
widgets.radio.BooleanRadio.left_label1.f: The text displayed to the left of the first radio button
widgets.radio.BooleanRadio.left_label2: The text displayed to the left of the second radio button
widgets.radio.BooleanRadio.left_label2.f: The text displayed to the left of the second radio button
widgets.radio.BooleanRadio.left_style1: The css style of the label to the left of the first radio button
